enabled.description: Activate the anonymous access to the repository manager. Default: false

realm_name.description: The name of the used realm. Default: "NexusAuthorizingRealm"

user_id.description: The user id used by anonymous access. Default: "anonymous"

path.description: The path to the blobstore contents. This can be an absolute path to anywhere on the system nxrm has access to or it can be a path relative to the sonatype-work directory

total_size_in_bytes.description: The total size of the blobstore in Bytes

type.description: The type of the blobstore. Possible values: `S3` or `File`

endpoint.description: A custom endpoint URL for third party object stores using the S3 API.

force_path_style.description: Setting this flag will result in path-style access being used for all requests.

signer_type.description: An API signature version which may be required for third party object stores using the S3 API.

block.description: Additional connection configurations

expiration.description: How many days until deleted blobs are finally removed from the S3 bucket (-1 to disable)

name.description: The name of the S3 bucket

prefix.description: The S3 blob store (i.e S3 object) key prefix

region.description: The AWS region to create a new S3 bucket in or an existing S3 bucket's region

block.description: The S3 bucket configuration

access_key_id.description: An IAM access key ID for granting access to the S3 bucket

role.description: An IAM role to assume in order to access the S3 bucket

secret_access_key.description: The secret access key associated with the specified IAM access key ID

session_token.description: An AWS STS session token associated with temporary security credentials which grant access to the S3 bucket

block.description: Additional security configurations

encryption_type.description: The type of S3 server side encryption to use.

block.description: Additional bucket encryption configurations
The S3 bucket configuration. Needed for blobstore type 'S3'

limit.description: The limit in Bytes. Minimum value is 1000000

type.description: The type to use such as spaceRemainingQuota, or spaceUsedQuota

block.description: Soft quota of the blobstore

description.description: A description of the content selector

actions.description: Actions for the privilege (browse, read, edit, add, delete, all and run)

content_selector.description: The content selector for the privilege

script_name.description: The script name related to the privilege

name.description: A unique identifier for this repository

online.description: Whether this repository accepts incoming requests

block.description: Apt specific configuration of the repository

keypair.description: PGP signing key pair (armored private key e.g. gpg --export-secret-key --armor )

block.description: Apt signing configuration for the repository

rewrite_package_urls.description: Force Bower to retrieve packages through the proxy repository

block.description: Bower specific configuration of the repository
Cleanup policies

force_basic_auth.description: Whether to force authentication (Docker Bearer Token Realm required if false)

http_port.description: Create an HTTP connector at specified port

https_port.description: Create an HTTPS connector at specified port

v1enabled.description: Whether to allow clients to use the V1 API to interact with this repository

block.description: Docker specific configuration of the repository

index_url.description: URL of Docker Index to use

block.description: Configuration for docker proxy repository
Configuration for repository group

auto_block.description: Whether to auto-block outbound connections if remote peer is detected as unreachable/unresponsive

blocked.description: Whether to block outbound connections on the repository

password.description: The password used by the proxy repository

username.description: The username used by the proxy repository

block.description: Authentication configuration of the HTTP client
HTTP Client configuration for proxy repositories

layout_policy.description: Validate that all paths are maven artifact or metadata paths. Possible values: `PERMISSIVE` or `STRICT`

version_policy.description: What type of artifacts does this repository store? Possible values: `RELEASE`, `SNAPSHOT` or `MIXED

block.description: Maven specific configuration of the repository

enabled.description: Whether to cache responses for content not present in the proxied repository

ttl.description: How long to cache the fact that a file was not found in the repository (in minutes)

block.description: Configuration of the negative cache handling

query_cache_item_max_age.description: What type of artifacts does this repository store

block.description: Configuration for the nuget proxy repository

content_max_age.description: How long (in minutes) to cache artifacts before rechecking the remote repository

metadata_max_age.description: How long (in minutes) to cache metadata before rechecking the remote repository.

remote_url.description: Location of the remote repository being proxied

block.description: Configuration for the proxy repository

blob_store_name.description: Blob store used to store repository contents

strict_content_type_validation.description: Whether to validate uploaded content's MIME type appropriate for the repository format

write_policy.description: Controls if deployments of and updates to assets are allowed

block.description: The storage configuration of the repository

deploy_policy.description: Validate that all paths are RPMs or yum metadata. Possible values: `STRICT` or `PERMISSIVE`

repodata_depth.description: Specifies the repository depth where repodata folder(s) are created. Possible values: 0-5

block.description: Yum specific configuration of the repository

description.description: The description of the routing rule

matchers.description: Matchers is a list of regular expressions used to identify request paths that are allowed or blocked (depending on above mode)

mode.description: The mode describe how to hande with mathing requests. Possible values: `BLOCK` or `ALLOW` Default: `BLOCK`

name.description: The name of the routing rule

type.description: The type of the script. Default: `groovy`

auth_password.description: The password to bind with. Required if authScheme other than none.

auth_realm.description: The SASL realm to bind to. Required if authScheme is CRAM_MD5 or DIGEST_MD5

auth_schema.description: Authentication scheme used for connecting to LDAP server

auth_username.description: This must be a fully qualified username if simple authentication is used. Required if authScheme other than none.

connection_retry_delay_seconds.description: How long to wait before retrying

connection_timeout_seconds.description: How long to wait before timeout

group_base_dn.description: The relative DN where group objects are found (e.g. ou=Group). This value will have the Search base DN value appended to form the full Group search base DN.

group_id_attribute.description: This field specifies the attribute of the Object class that defines the Group ID. Required if groupType is static

group_member_attribute.description: LDAP attribute containing the usernames for the group. Required if groupType is static

group_member_format.description: The format of user ID stored in the group member attribute. Required if groupType is static

group_object_class.description: LDAP class for group objects. Required if groupType is static

group_subtree.description: Are groups located in structures below the group base DN

group_type.description: Defines a type of groups used: static (a group contains a list of users) or dynamic (a user contains a list of groups). Required if ldapGroupsAsRoles is true.

ldap_groups_as_roles.description: Denotes whether LDAP assigned roles are used as Nexus Repository Manager roles

port.description: LDAP server connection port to use

protocol.description: LDAP server connection Protocol to use

search_base.description: LDAP location to be added to the connection URL

use_trust_store.description: Whether to use certificates stored in Nexus Repository Manager's truststore

user_base_dn.description: The relative DN where user objects are found (e.g. ou=people). This value will have the Search base DN value appended to form the full User search base DN.

user_email_address_attribute.description: This is used to find an email address given the user ID

user_id_attribute.description: This is used to find a user given its user ID

user_ldap_filter.description: LDAP search filter to limit user search

user_member_of_attribute.description: Set this to the attribute used to store the attribute which holds groups DN in the user object. Required if groupType is dynamic

user_password_attribute.description: If this field is blank the user will be authenticated against a bind with the LDAP server

user_real_name_attribute.description: This is used to find a real name given the user ID

user_subtree.description: Are users located in structures below the user base DN?

email_attribute.description: IdP field mappings for user's email address

first_name_attribute.description: IdP field mappings for user's given name

groups_attribute.description: IdP field mappings for user's groups

last_name_attribute.description: IdP field mappings for user's family name

validate_assertion_signature.description: By default, if a signing key is found in the IdP metadata, then NXRM will attempt to validate signatures on the assertions.

validate_response_signature.description: By default, if a signing key is found in the IdP metadata, then NXRM will attempt to validate signatures on the response.

email.description: The email address associated with the user.

firstname.description: The first name of the user.

lastname.description: The last name of the user.

roles.description: The roles which the user has been assigned within Nexus.

status.description: The user's status, e.g. active or disabled.

userid.description: The userid which is required for login. This value cannot be changed.

enabled.description: Activate the feature of user tokens.

protect_content.description: Require user tokens for repository authentication. This does not effect UI access.
